conclusion: Problem involves light refracting from air into water, determining if O1 is to the right of O.
Horizontal boundary line separates air and water; Point A in air, points B, C, D in water; Point O is intersection of line AB and boundary.
Snell's Law relates angles of incidence and refraction: n1 * sin(i) = n2 * sin(r).
Refractive index for air is approximately 1.0003, for water around 1.333 for blue light.
Light ray path is from A to B, passing through boundary at O1, not along straight line AB.
O1 is where light ray enters water, not necessarily same as point O.
Light bends towards normal when entering water from air.
In diagram, O1 seems to be to the right of O, light ray bends towards normal at O1.
Suppose point A in air, points B, C, D in water; boundary is horizontal.
Straight line from A to B intersects boundary at O, actual path is A to O1 to B.
Angle of incidence i is greater than angle of refraction r.
Considering geometry, O1 is to the right of O due to bending towards normal.
